channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: The towns taking THEMSELVES out of lockdown
item.description: In Alresford, Hampshire, eight high street businesses are now open, including a salon - despite the government insisting hairdressers should not yet be open.

item.title: Hollywood actor Hagen Mills, 29, 'commits suicide after shooting mom of his four-year-old daughter'
item.description: The 29-year-old actor, who appeared in the hit FX series Baskets, reportedly tried to kill 34-year-old Erica Price at a residence in Mayfield on Tuesday evening, before he turned the gun on himself.

item.title: Eighty firefighters are sent to blaze tearing through a block of flats in southeast London
item.description: The London Fire Brigade was called at 07:26 p.m. on Wednesday evening about a fire in a sixth-floor flat on Childers Street in Deptford, south-east London.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn supports protests against June school reopening
item.description: The Islington North MP, 70, was the keynote speaker at an online rally organised by the Healthworker Coronavirus Activists Group.

item.title: Superdrug sells coronavirus antibody test for £69
item.description: The test is produced by Abbott, which was the second antibody test approved by ministers after Roche. Blood samples have to be posted to a laboratory, therefore it isn't a 'DIY' test.

item.title: Mother and adult daughter still SHOWER together every day
item.description: Mary, 55, and Brittani, 19, from Jensen Beach, Florida, are one of the six mother-daughter duos featured on the second season of TLC's reality series sMothered.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi calls Trump a 'kid with doggy do on his shoes'
item.description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi doubled down on her insults to President Trump, saying she was giving him a 'dose of his own medicine' and comparing him to a little kid who with doggy do on his shoes.

item.title: Director urges boycott of censored God's Own Country on Amazon
item.description: Francis Lee tweeted Tuesday: 'Until this is investigated please do not rent or buy on Amazon Prime. It is not the film I intended or made.' Amazon said the distributor is responsible.

item.title: Curtis Sittenfeld book reimagines Bill and Hillary Clinton's past
item.description: New fictionalized book Rodham from bestselling author Curtis Sittenfeld imagines Hillary Clinton's life if she rejected Bill's proposal in 1974.

item.title: Poll: Almost two thirds of Brits would feel uncomfortable going to the pub after lockdown
item.description: Almost two thirds of Britons would feel uncomfortable going to the pub or taking a foreign holiday when lockdown ends, according to a new survey.

item.title: Ukraine hacker caught attempting to sell 773m passwords
item.description: According to KrebsOnSecurity, the Security Service of Ukraine (SBU) said it detained a hacker known as Sanix in association with the stolen data set that came to light last year.

item.title: Coronavirus Australia: Face masks and customer limits in shops
item.description: Following weeks of strict lockdown restrictions, Britons could soon face a range of changes to the way they shop for clothes as the government begins to issue advice on which stores can open.

item.title: Greece will allow international flights into the country from July 1
item.description: Italian minister Paola De Micheli told lawmawkers on Wednesday, 'It will be possible to reopen all airports from June 3, when regional and international transfers will be allowed again.'
item.media:credit: 8337687 Boost for Australians hoping to travel to the UK as Britain considers letting Aussies SKIP mandatory 14-day quarantine on arrival as Fiji bids to join Trans-Tasman travel bubble

item.title: Fears for missing Shad Gaspard as body washes up on beach
item.description: The devastated wife and family of former WWE star Shad Gaspard gathered at Venice Beach on Wednesday, hours after the missing father's body washed up on the shore.

item.title: Coronavirus: Apple and Google launch contact-tracing software
item.description: Apple and Google did not reveal which countries are set to use the API but it is believed it will be adopted by several US states, Latvia, Ireland, Italy, Switzerland, Germany and the Netherlands.

item.title: Coronavirus: Trump accuses China of 'mass worldwide killing'
item.description: Trump bashed China for its 'incompetence' leading to worldwide deaths from the coronavirus pandemic - as the U.S. maintains the highest number of cases and deaths of any other country.

item.title: Britain sneaks back to the pub! Smart-thinking landlords find ways around lockdown rules
item.description: Visitors along Brighton beach can be seen carrying pints in plastic cups, while punters were queuing outside the Old King's Head in Shoreditch on Wednesday afternoon for a drink.

item.title: Thousands of locked-down Brits cram onto packed beaches as temperatures soar to 82F
item.description: Sunbathers are making the most of their new-found freedom following the easing of lockdown restrictions, with the mercury set to hit 82F (28C) in the south-east of England today.

item.title: 75-page hospitality industry report sets out roadmap to getting restaurants and pubs open on July 4
item.description: The newly-released document gives a glimpse of how restaurants, bars and other leisure facilities will operate.

item.title: Phillip Schofield begs for pubs to open
item.description: Phillip Schofield begged for pubs to open in an impassioned rant on Wednesday which saw him trending on Twitter.

item.title: Dramatic aerial photographs show extent of Wareham Forest fire
item.description: Dramatic drone footage of the blaze in Wareham Forest, Dorset, shows huge swathes of woodland ablaze, with flames threatening to engulf the surrounding countryside.

item.title: Culture secretary Oliver Dowden boosts hopes of free-to-air Premier League TV deal
item.description: Fans have been given encouragement that some Premier League matches will be televised free-to-air after 'productive discussions' between the Government and English football authorities.

item.title: Canadian scientists are testing whether marijuana compound can prevent coronavirus infection
item.description: Researchers from the University of Lethbridge in Alberta, Canada found that cannabis extracts lowered the number of receptors coronavirus uses to infects cells and multiply by more than 70%.

item.title: SAGE file claims BAME Britons are at risk of coronavirus because of higher diabetes rates
item.description: Research by the universities of Edinburgh and Liverpool, presented to SAGE, showed that ethnicity did not have a bearing on death rate in intensive care but it did affect odds of admission.

item.title: Marks & Spencer reveals shoppers are buying PJS and vegetables but not suits during lockdown
item.description: Over 360,000 existing M&S customers in the UK hopped online for the first time during lockdown, while the company gained 315,000 new online shoppers as Britons adjusted to lockdown.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 363 more deaths in hospitals as case rate slows
item.description: Data from Public Health England has so far discovered no new cases of the coronavirus from specimens provided in London and the South East on May 18, the most recently available data.

item.title: 'Torso in the woods' suspect is seen for the first time since his bail release
item.description: Phoenix Netts (pictured right), whose body was found last week in suitcases dumped in the Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire, was killed at a homeless hostel.

item.title: Welsh police fine English day trippers driving to Brecon Beacons amid surge in campsite bookings
item.description: Superintendent Clark Jones-John of Dyfed Powys Police said a number of cars heading to the popular camping destination had been turned around in recent weeks.

item.title: Culture secretary announces task force to help Premier League and other sports get up and running
item.description: Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden has revealed he is 'setting up a renewal task force' as the Government look to get sporting and cultural events back underway again in a 'crowd-free' way.

item.title: Tragic past of 'torso in the woods' victim who dropped out of university before being killed
item.description: Phoenix Netts, whose body was found last week in suitcases dumped in the Forest of Dean, Gloucestershire, was killed at a homeless hostel after dropping out of university and falling into drugs.

item.title: Ronan Farrow says Matt Lauer is 'just wrong' after disgraced anchor hit out
item.description: Ronan Farrow took to Twitter to defend himself against allegations of 'shoddy journalism' by Lauer, who was accused of rape by ex-colleague Brooke Nevils in Farrow's book Catch and Kill.

item.title: Families of immigrant NHS staff and care workers can stay in UK
item.description: The Home Office announced it is extending the offer of indefinite leave to remain, free of charge, to the relatives of support staff after an outcry.

item.title: Colourised pictures show how Britain enjoyed beach holidays in 1890
item.description: Colourised pictures of how Britons enjoyed beach holidays back in 1890 have been revealed as British holidays look to become the norm due to the impact of Covid-19.

item.title: High Court judge blasts Haringey Council social workers over new scandal
item.description: Mr Justice Hayden spoke of a 'litany of failure' at Haringey Council in north London, which was criticised after the deaths of eight-year-old Victoria Climbie in 2000 and 'Baby P' Peter Connelly (left) in 2007.

item.title: PM says frontline workers battling Covid-19 will be recognised by the Queen in Birthday Honours .
item.description: The Prime Minister said the publication of the Queen's Birthday Honours list will be moved from June to the autumn so it can reflect the work of people battling coronavirus on different fronts.

item.title: Scientists use ultrasound waves to control the brains of monkeys
item.description: Scientists in the US have used ultrasound waves to control the brains of monkeys, which they say could lead to a treatment for decision-making-related disorders in humans such as addiction.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Major banks continue to work from home
item.description: Pictures this week showed the capital's major financial hub in Canary Wharf (pictured) virtually empty as City workers stayed at home.

item.title: McDonald's is reopening 30 more drive-thru restaurants TODAY after coronavirus lockdown
item.description: McDonald's reopened 30 of its restaurants today as the fast-food giant sets about its re-opening strategy amid the coronavirus lockdown. The chain will see its drive-thru service reopen.

item.title: Youths set cars on fire in Paris after death of motorcyclist
item.description: Tensions rose after the death of Sabri Choubi, 18, in a motorcycle accident last weekend. The victim's associates alleged that a collision with a police car caused his death, the investigation is ongoing.

item.title: The Airbnb villa used as Marcus's house in Netflix's White Lines
item.description: The real-life villa is actually called Villa Can Pirata and is located in Cala d'Or in Majorca. It can accommodate 10 guests and boasts four bathrooms.

item.title: Midwest is hit by flooding as Chicago River burst its banks and Michigan residents are evacuated
item.description: The NWS issued a flash flood watch for locations along the Tittabawassee River after the breach at the Edenville Dam in Midland County and the Sanford Dam.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Harsher punishment for coughing at key workers
item.description: Priti Patel today warned that people who cough in the faces of key workers during the coronavirus outbreak could see their prison sentence doubled.

item.title: Bionic eye, sensitive as human retina, may give sight to millions
item.description: Named EC-EYE - short for 'ElectroChemical EYE' - the eerie bio-mimetic device is around an inch wide and was built by researchers from Hong Kong and the US.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN on 'disgusting' Immigrant Health Surcharge
item.description: PIERS MORGAN: Six weeks ago, Boris Johnson lay in the intensive care unit of a London hospital. By his own account, doctors and nurses filled him with 'litres of oxygen' to keep him alive.

item.title: Police discover 'sophisticated' cannabis farm hidden inside two homes in Manchester
item.description: Officers uncovered 110 marijuana plants with street value of up to £40,000 in Manchester. An Albanian immigrant has been jailed for 12 months after he admitted producing cannabis.

item.title: Rolls-Royce chief executive SMIRKS discussing 9,000 job cuts
item.description: Warren East, 58, appeared to smirk and stared off camera as he was questioned by BBC host Victoria Derbyshire over the number of job cuts to the aerospace giant's workforce in the UK.

item.title: Astronomers discover galaxy with intact disc 1.5 billion years after the Big Bang
item.description: The Wolfe Disk galaxy was found by astronomers from the National Radio Astronomy Observatory using the Atacama Large Millimeter/submillimeter Array (ALMA).

item.title: Car thief slides through the window of a £46k Audi and uses keyless hack to steal it in 40 seconds
item.description: The gang stole a £46,000 Audi S4 on Moseley Road, Birmingham, at around 4pm yesterday. Shocking footage shows them commit the the robbery in daylight despite people walking past on the street.

item.title: Walt Disney's grandson Brad Lund criticizes bonuses for executives who furloughed 100,000 workers
item.description: Walt Disney grandson and heir Brad Lund, 50, said he hoped all family members would join in his dismay at alleged extra compensation for senior management after workers were furloughed.

item.title: James Dyson reveals 'risky' scrapped £500m electric car
item.description: British billionaire Sir James Dyson has unveiled the sole prototype of his company's electric car that was cancelled for being 'too risky'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Earlier lockdown could have saved 11k lives
item.description: Research by Dr John Dagpunar at the University of Southampton modelled the outcomes of an earlier lockdown and he said: 'earlier action was needed and would have saved many lives'.

item.title: First-time buyers face mortgage crisis as firms withdraw or lower offers fearing house price crash
item.description: Homebuyers including Richard and Wendy Sumner (pictured) from south London, have had to delay their dream moves because of the expensive deposits offered by lenders.

item.title: ONS: House prices up 2.1% in March before Covid-19 freeze crashed sales
item.description: House prices and sales continued to rise in the build up to the lockdown, ONS figures show, but the market was then abruptly halted.

item.title: Britain First leader Paul Golding is found guilty of terror offence
item.description: Golding (pictured) from Stockport denied the charge but was found guilty of the offence following a trial at Westminster Magistrates' Court in London on Wednesday.

item.title: Boris Johnson accuses Keir Starmer of being 'negative' in PMQs clash over coroanavirus test woes
item.description: Routine testing for those with symptoms was abandoned on March 12, when the government shifted to its 'delay' phase, with checks reserved for hospital patients and health staff.

item.title: UN pushes Australians to use gender-neutral language like 'ya'll'
item.description: The national branch of the global organisation UN Women Australia tweeted part of a new dictionary on Monday.

item.title: The Rolling Stones' Ronnie Wood on ageing and beating cancer
item.description: The Rolling Stones legend also discussed beating lung cancer after 54 years of smoking 25 to 30 cigarettes a day and claimed that it was a 'get out of jail free card'.

item.title: Ex-Green Beret and son are arrested by US officials for helping Ghosn
item.description: Federal prosecutors in Massachusetts said that former U.S. Green Beret Michael Taylor and his son, Peter Taylor, helped Ghosn last year flee to Lebanon.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 20 of 60 care home residents died with symptoms
item.description: Paisley Court Care Home, in Dovecot, can care for 60 elderly people. If it's at full capacity, it means a third of its residents have died of the virus. But it's not clear if this is the case.

item.title: Mary-Kate Olsen and Olivier Sarkozy clashed over having kids
item.description: Sarkozy, who has two adult kids with his ex-wife Charlotte Bernard, is said to have not wanted to start a family with Olsen, while she did.

item.title: Union bosses boast 'the state is back' and demand a public sector pay rise
item.description: TUC general secretary Frances O'Grady believes Britain must show the same level of unity as it did after the Second World War in order to heal society and the economy in the coming years.

item.title: Farmer convicted of drowning wife in liquid manure in Germany
item.description: A 55-year-old farmer was sentenced to 13-and-a-half years in prison after his wife died in a slurry pit on their farm in Germany in 2018. File image.

item.title: Father and son die after attack by water buffalo on Welsh farm
item.description: Peter Jump (pictured), 19, suffered fatal injuries when his father Ralph, 57, was crushed to death by the giant animal rampaging at their farm in Gwehelog, Monmouthshire, Wales.

item.title: 70m-year-old remains of 33-feet-long megaraptor found
item.description: The remains of one of the last carnivorous dinosaur to roam the Earth have been found in Argentina. Experts uncovered what was once a 33-foot long megaraptor that lived 70 million years ago.

item.title: 25 migrants picked up attempting to cross English Channel
item.description: Brexit Party leader Nigel Farage was on a chartered fishing vessel this morning which witnessed two groups of migrants attempting to cross the English Channel.

item.title: Grand Tour host James May's £3million superhome nears completion and will store huge car collection
item.description: Work is nearing completion on the £3million superhome James May is building to house his forty motorbikes and luxury car collection. Latest images reveal the fresh exterior and garage.

item.title: Spiders that hunt in packs can bring down prey 22 times their size
item.description: Social spiders were found to target prey two-and-a-half times their size on average, while solitary spiders tended to go for creatures that were half as large as themselves.

item.title: Vegan transforms her body in 12 weeks of coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Rebecca Hanna, 28, from Meersbrook in Sheffield, started a strict 12-week regime on 12th February that saw her start daily exercise and ditch carb-heavy meals such as chips with curry sauce.

item.title: Woman dresses in inflatable hippo costume so she can hug her mother at a Virginia retirement home
item.description: Nick Bolerjack recorded the moment his mother-in-law hugged her parent in an inflatable hippo costume outside the Fox Trail Senior Living Home in Stephens City, Virginia.

item.title: Mother-of-three claims she looks like a human 'Shar Pei' dog after five botched surgeries
item.description: WARNING: Graphic content. Katherine Hanna, from Ridgefield, in Washington, was left with life-changing scars on her abdomen and breasts after a botched body lift she underwent in 2019.

item.title: New Facebook AI will trawl pictures searching in an attempt to 'make everything shoppable'
item.description: The AI, which is being rolled out in tandem with a new 'Shops' feature will scan images on Facebook and use machine-learning to identify specific products, including the brand, material and more.

item.title: Blind climber scales 449-foot sea stack with the help of his wife
item.description: BBC Four documentary 'Climbing Blind' sees Jesse Dufton,34, from Loughborough, who has less than 20 per cent vision, climb Old Man of Hoy with the help of his wife Molly.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Nurse loses 50lb after battle with illness
item.description: Mike Schultz, 43, was only released from a Massachusetts hospital last week after spending 57 days battling coronavirus-induced pneumonia.

item.title: Adorable moment panda cub splashes around in a paddling pool at Berlin Zoo
item.description: One of Berlin Zoo's young panda cubs Paule was caught on film playfully splashing in a paddling pool as he enjoyed 72F temperatures in the German capital on Monday.

item.title: Barack Obama would beat Donald Trump by landslide, says poll
item.description: Barack Obama would beat Donald Trump if he could run for president again by more than 10 per cent if an election were held today, a poll revealed Wednesday, as tensions between the two spiked this month.

item.title: No kidding! Goats can understand human gestures
item.description: A team of international researchers, which included experts from the UK, found that goats, like dogs and horses, are able to interpret a pointed finger.

item.title: Celebrity law firm says it will not pay $42million ransom after it is targeted by hackers
item.description: Grubman Shire Meiselas & Sacks said it will not pay the $42million ransom to hackers who have threatened to release damaging information on celebrity clients including Lady Gaga and Madonna.

item.title: How to make a Nandos Portugese tart at home
item.description: The team behind The Big Bakes, a British company that runs baking competitions, has shared a recipe to recreate Nando's signature Portugese Tarts, or Pastel De Nata in nine simple steps.

item.title: Volkswagen apologises for 'racist' advert showing white hand flicking black person away from car
item.description: A ten-second advert posted on Instagram and Twitter shows a giant white hand pushing a black man away from a new, yellow Volkswagen Golf parked on the street.

item.title: Bank of England 'could turn interest rates NEGATIVE'
item.description: Bank governor Andrew Bailey told MPs it would be 'foolish' to rule out the move - which would effectively mean institutions paying to keep cash in the bank.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Charts show economy in unprecedented recession
item.description: Apocalyptic predictions from the Bank and England and others show the UK is on track for the worst recession in 300 years, when the Great Frost swept Europe.

item.title: Elisabeth of Belgium who studied in Wales, enrolls at Brussels' Military Academy
item.description: Princess Elisabeth of Belgium, 18, heir to the throne, will enroll at Brussels' Royal Military Academy in the autumn, the royal family announced today.

item.title: 25 caravans arrive in Wickham despite horse fair cancellation
item.description: Travellers have arrived in Wickham, Hampshire despite the horse fair's official cancellation Organisers confirmed it would not take place this year to help contain the outbreak.

item.title: Zara leaves shoppers perplexed over bizarre model poses
item.description: British shoppers have taken to Twitter this week to complain about Spanish clothing giant Zara's bizarre model snaps, which showcase the High Street store's Spring-Summer 2020 garments.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Risk for children 'unbelievably low' says expert
item.description: Eminent statistician Sir David Spiegelhalter said data has also shown that it is 'extremely' unlikely a child under 14 will fall seriously ill with the disease. English schools are due to reopen in June.

item.title: Parkour star arrested in Iran for 'vulgar acts' after posting photos kissing a woman on a rooftop
item.description: Alireza Japalaghy, 28, a Tehran-based parkour athlete was reportedly arrested yesterday for committing 'vulgar' acts after he posted photos of himself kissing a woman on a roof in Tehran, Iran.

item.title: Leaders of the National Education Union are caught discussing how to 'threaten' headmasters
item.description: Mary Bousted, the NEU's joint general secretary, was even shown accusing children of being 'mucky', spreading germs and 'wiping their snot on your trousers or on your dress' in a Zoom call (pictured).

item.title: Asylum seeker jailed for more than six years for grabbing woman and trying to rape her in alleyway
item.description: Abdul Nishat, 23, of Harehills, Leeds, committed the crime outside the University of Leeds, West Yorkshire, on November 30, 2019. Nishat was given an extended prison sentence.

item.title: Crane operator annoys sunbather by casting a shadow over him
item.description: A crane driver used the shadow cast by his lifting hook to annoy a sunbather thought to be in London. The hysterical video had a social media user saying: 'I've never wanted to be a crane operator more'.

item.title: Boy, 15, transforms bedroom for £200 with B&Q and eBay finds
item.description: Kane Hardy, 15, from Kings Lynn, Norfolk, has told how he transformed his bedroom for £200 - using bargain products that her purchased from the likes of B&M and eBay.

item.title: Man is arrested for hanging out a towel showing the British flag from his balcony in Turkey
item.description: The man was led away to cheers from nearby residents who had complained that the flag was a provocative act on a Turkish public holiday (file photo).

item.title: Parents in Germany receive 20 weeks' pay for loss of work while looking after children in lockdown
item.description: Single parents could be eligible for 20 weeks pay while cohabiting parents can apply for up to ten weeks of wages as a 'secondary salary payment', upper limit of €2,016 per month.

item.title: 50 photos from around the world reveal how people have coped with isolation during the pandemic
item.description: The photographs were submitted from across the world - including as far as Kenya, Ghana and Colombia - as part of a competition themed around the idea of staying at home.

item.title: Students opt to defer as Cambridge becomes first to axe all face-to-face learning
item.description: Experts from consultancy firm London Economics say a 17 per cent drop in prospective university students, deferring due to Covid-19, would cost the sector £763m in lost tuition fees and teaching grants.

item.title: Brother of Twilight's Gregory Tyree Boyce tells of shock at death
item.description: Boyce, 30, and his partner Natalie Adepoju, 28, were found dead inside the bedroom of their Las Vegas home by their roommate, Louis Ledbetter, on May 13. Officers said the couple.

item.title: China says boy picked by Dalai Lama now a college graduate
item.description: Very little information has been given about Gedhun Choekyi Nyima or his family since he went missing at the age of six - shortly after being named as the 11th Panchen Lama.

item.title: New Chinese coronavirus outbreak shows signs pathogen could be changing
item.description: Patients in Jilin and Heilongjiang have been carrying the virus for longer and taking more time to recover than their predecessors in Wuhan, a leading doctor said.

item.title: British firm ground tests rocket - a first on UK soil for 50 years
item.description: The company created a mobile launch platform and finished a full fire test of its Skylark-L rocket in just five days - the first from the UK in 50 years.

item.title: Detectives arrest three more men over law student's murder
item.description: Aya Hachem was hit in the chest by one of several shots fired as she walked to a Lidl supermarket near her home in Blackburn, Lancashire at around 3pm on Sunday.

item.title: First Jaguar Land Rover car drives off the production line during lockdown
item.description: An £84,000 Range Rover was the first new car to be completed in lockdown as the British firm looked to kickstart efforts to recover from the collapse in new vehicle demand caused by the pandemic.

item.title: Princess Eugenie was told to 'prepare for the worst' as father-in-law battled coronavirus
item.description: Princess Eugenie, 30, and her husband Jack Brooksbank were told 'more than once' to 'expect the worse' as Jack's father George, 71, battled coronavirus in intensive care in London.

item.title: The $159k Pittsbugh house for sale that has an indoor BEACH
item.description: The two-storey property, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is on the market for $159,000 and has garnered attention from social media users around the world after the listing was shared on Twitter.

item.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton change the display names on social media accounts
item.description: Prince William, 37, and Kate Middleton, 38, have changed their display name on Twitter and Instagram from 'Kensington Palace' to 'The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge.'

item.title: Softbank CEO compares himself to 'misunderstood' Jesus Christ as he defends £13billion annual loss
item.description: Founder Masayoshi Son, 62, used slides illustrated with a set of unicorns falling into a ravine to demonstrate the effect of coronavirus on Japanese Softbank during an earnings call on Monday.

item.title: The winning images from a landscape photography contest that showcase the beauty of planet earth
item.description: The images were all finalists in the 2020 Landscape Photography Competition, which is run by The Independent Photographer - an international network of photographers.

item.title: Russian ex-spy charged with downing MH17 jet says he 'feels a moral responsibility'
item.description: Igor Girkin (pictured) is one of four people accused of murder over the missile shot in July 2014 which killed all 298 people on the Malaysia Airlines flight over Ukraine.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle were 'reflective' on their second wedding anniversary
item.description: Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle, 38, who are currently living in LA, were feeling 'quite reflective' on their second wedding anniversary yesterday, a source told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl.

item.title: Astronomers find first direct evidence of new world being formed around distant star
item.description: A dense disc of dust and gas has been spotted surrounding a young star called AB Aurigae, around 520 light years away from Earth.

item.title: Astonishing moment the sea level plunges at a Sicilian port
item.description: Locals watched on as the 'Marrobbio' phenomenon rapidly sucked water out of the port of San Leone on Italian island of Sicily into the sea following a sudden change in air pressure.

item.title: Lindsay Hoyle threatens to kick Matt Hancock out of Commons
item.description: Sir Lindsay Hoyle today threatened to kick Matt Hancock out of the House of Commons after the Health Secretary interrupted Sir Keir Starmer at PMQs.

item.title: Female wingsuit flyer's last moments show her cameraman desperately trying to warn her
item.description: The tourist from Beijing, who remains unidentified, was reported missing for seven days before her body was found in a dense wood inside Tianmen Mountain National Park in China on Monday.

item.title: Laughing gas given off by large quantities of penguin poo made researchers go 'cuckoo' in Antarctica
item.description: King penguins' faeces reacts with soil to produce tonnes of nitrous oxide, according to Professor Bo Elberling, of the University of Copenhagen.

item.title: Adorable humpback dolphin named Mystique presents a series of gifts to volunteers
item.description: Mystique the humpback dolphin brings treasures from the bottom of the ocean to visitors at the Barnacles Café and Dolphin Feeding centre on Queensland's Cooloola Coast.

item.title: Outspoken headteacher pleads with parents NOT to send their children back to school
item.description: A headteacher has warned parents not to send kids back to school ahead of the proposed June 1 reopening. Louise McMillan, of St Bede's, Cumbria made the comment on social media.

item.title: Self-proclaimed Tai Chi master, 69, gets knocked out by a kickboxing coach, 50
item.description: Viral footage shows Ma Baoguo, the self-appointed expert, being punched to the ground three times within half a minute by Wang Qingming, during an amateur match on Sunday afternoon in China.

item.title: Government scientist says 2m social distancing rule based on 'very fragile' evidence
item.description: Professor Robert Dingwall, a sociologist at Nottingham Trent University and an adviser to the UK Government, said the WHO and many countries in Europe are using a one-metre rule.

item.title: Airbnb reveals 10 most wish-listed homes since lockdown
item.description: The global renting platform has today unveiled a list of the 10 most wish-listed properties on the site between March 11 and May 4. Every one of them is a gem.

item.title: Mother who still breastfeeds her five-year-old and two-year-old sons, says critics LACK education
item.description: Laura Smith, 25, from Michigan, is encouraging more mothers to continue breastfeeding their children at any age, as she still nurses her five-year-old Joel and two-year-old son Bennett.

item.title: Meghan Markle's wedding dress designer shares memories
item.description: British designer Clare Waight Keller, 49, creative director of Givenchy, shared her memories of the 'relaxed' royal family and flag-waving crowds to mark the second anniversary yesterday.

item.title: $90m F-35 stealth fighter crashes at Florida air force base
item.description: A U.S. Air Force F-35 stealth fighter jet crashed at the Eglin Air Force in Florida around 9.30pm Tuesday night, four days after a F-22 Raptor fighter jet crashed at the same airfield

item.title: Brisk walk or bike ride for 30 minutes three times a week can stave off dementia in over-60s
item.description: A study, carried out by researchers at Texas-based UT Southwestern Medical Centre, found that exercise increased blood flow to two regions of the brain associated with improved memory.

item.title: Antarctica could turn GREEN as climate change causes algae to bloom across the surface of the snow
item.description: Botanists from the University of Cambridge created the first ever large-scale map of microscopic algae blooming along the Antarctic coastline.

item.title: Rose McGowan says she's 'in a good place' after rapist Harvey Weinstein's 23-year prison sentence
item.description: The disgraced movie mogul, 68, was convicted in March in a landmark #MeToo case that ended with six of his accusers sobbing and hugging each other from the front row of the courtroom.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg tells MPs they MUST return to Commons
item.description: Jacob Rees-Mogg today told MPs they should no longer work from home and must physically return to Westminster if they want to participate in debates and vote on new laws.

item.title: Jacinda Ardern urges employers to move to a four day week to help boost tourism amid coronavirus
item.description: Ms Ardern was finishing up a short trip to Rotorua on Monday when she decided to check-in with New Zealanders via Facebook livestream.

item.title: Rolls-Royce will cut 9,000 aerospace jobs to save £1.3billion
item.description: Rolls-Royce CEO, Warren East - pictured in 2018 - said the job cuts were necessary to protect the company's future amid the huge slump in demand for the company's plane engines.

item.title: Woman, 30, is charged with murder of seven-year-old
item.description: Eltiona Skana, 30, is accused of the murder of Emily Jones, who was killed in an 'unprovoked and random' attack in Queen's Park, Bolton on Sunday, March 22.

item.title: Heartwarming moment elephant discovers a tree trunk is the perfect thing to scratch a jumbo itch
item.description: An Asian elephant called Cartoon, 58, was filmed scratching her head and legs at Samui Elephant Sanctuary in Koh Samui, southern Thailand. Australian-born Fiona watched the elephant.

item.title: Princess Victoria of Sweden celebrates World Bee Day by sharing snaps of her children
item.description: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden has shared adorable family pictures, taken at Haga Palace, the family's official residence on the outskirts of Stockholm, to mark World Bee Day.

item.title: Brilliant hack for cleaning a garbage disposal with ice is going viral on TikTok
item.description: TikTok user @dm3lt shared the trick on May 7; it's been viewed 5.9 million times. She stuffed ice cubes into her garbage disposal and ran it normally.

item.title: Ronan Farrow facing criticism for his reporting around #MeToo
item.description: Ronan Farrow has risen to prominence off the back of his exposes of sex scandals involving powerful men including Harvey Weinstein, but now his methods are being called into question.

item.title: Boris Johnson looks pale on morning run after coronavirus scare
item.description: The Prime Minister, 55, appears pale and thin in pictures as he returns to Downing Street after his morning exercise, wearing a white T-shirt bearing a brightly-coloured design.

item.title: Terrifying moment masked gunman opens fire in kebab shop leaving bullet hole in donor meat
item.description: Workers in a north west London kebab shop were left terrified after masked gunmen stormed the shop and unleashed a flurry of bullets, late on Monday night in the Harrow area.

item.title: Face masks can curb spread of the coronavirus by up to 75%, study claims
item.description: Researchers in Hong Kong studied spread of the virus between hamsters. They found the transmission rate dropped when infected hamsters' cages were cloaked with a masked barrier.

item.title: Woman reveals how she wrote a letter to 'prove her worth' after reading government frailty guidance
item.description: Jenny Hirst, from the UK, has been shielding since March because of coronavirus. She told Radio 4' she was 'distressed' by government's frailty guidance.

item.title: Cold War spy satellite images reveal decline of Kazakhstan's bobak marmot
item.description: Images taken by US Cold War satellites have revealed the impact of farming on wildlife in the former Soviet state of Kazakhstan.

item.title: Beijing claims 'clever entrepreneurs won't give up the massive Chinese market' amid trade war fears
item.description: Zhong Shan, the head of China's Ministry of Commerce, declared that business-savvy Western firms would stay loyal to Beijing because the nation has 1.4 billion consumers and high-quality labour.

item.title: London mayor Sadiq Khan demands shops stock more face masks for commuters
item.description: Transport for London said during peak hours this week it ran 75 per cent of Tube services on average across the whole network as data shows there were 2,000 more commuters today on yesterday.

item.title: Britons vote BACON as the nation's favourite filling with cheese knocked from its top spot
item.description: Bacon - with no condiments or salad - was voted the best sandwich filling in a survey of 2,000 adults by Warburtons, followed by egg mayo, sausage, cheese and cheese and pickle.

item.title: Reckless driver is jailed for 26 months after smashing into police car in 100mph motorway chase
item.description: Wayne Smith, 27, ploughed his black Ford Focus into a police vehicle on the M5 in a dramatic collision which closed the motorway for ten hours on August 5 last year.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Plan to reopen schools from June collapses
item.description: Up to 1,500 English schools are now expected to remain closed in 12 days time despite millions of children being at home for more than eight weeks.

item.title: Vogue's Editor-in-chief Edward Enninful says it was 'cold and 'stand-offish'
item.description: British Vogue's Editor-in-chief Edward Enninful, 48, from London, told the Talk Art podcast that the magazine appeared 'cold and really stand-offish' before he took the reigns from Alexandra Shulman.

item.title: Horrifying moment thugs armed with a meat cleaver and knife slash at man lying in the street
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Video of a man being brutally attacked by two masked assailants in Hillingdon, London, has emerged on social media. One attacker carried a meat cleaver.

item.title: Siberia is hit by record 105.8F heatwave as Russian region 'skips spring'
item.description: Temperatures have touched 106F (41C) in the Altai Mountain foothills, with May records broken in many locations and residents basking in the Saudi-like temperatures at river and lake beaches.

item.title: Why is taxpayers' money being pumped into BBC Three? Bosses plan to double spending on youth network
item.description: The London-based Taxpayers' Alliance said the BBC should not 'replace public broadcasting with cash wasted on chasing a youth audience they have no hope of catching'.

item.title: Creepy abandoned Hertfordshire mansion is owned by mysterious Greek property tycoon
item.description: Villagers told how Athanasios Tachmintzis, 70, lived for around 18 years in the imposing house near King's Langley, Hertfordshire, before he disappeared more than three years ago.

item.title: Hairdresser reveals how she has started working again illegally during coronavirus crisis
item.description: A hairdresser has explained why she is flouting the coronavirus lockdown rules, having reopened her hair salon. 'Jane' and client 'Kate' cited economic and mental reasons for the move.

item.title: Bodycam footage shows Ahmaud Arbery getting arrested in 2017 for shoplifting
item.description: Police released video Tuesday of Ahmaud Arbery's December 1, 2017, arrest outside a Brunswick, Georgia, Walmart store on shoplifting charges.

item.title: Portugal's president Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa queues in a supermarket while wearing a facemask
item.description: A photo of Portuguese president Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa queuing in a supermarket in the municipality of Cascais near the capital Lisbon has been widely shared on social media.

item.title: Dog howls with excitement in a video call with its nurse owner who is stuck in quarantine
item.description: Heartwarming footage shows the nurse, from Danvers, Massachusetts, giving her 'signature' whistle to her pet pooch over a video call, and getting an excited howl in return.

item.title: Skeleton of a 300,000-year-old elephant with 8ft tusks is unearthed in Germany
item.description: The Eurasian straight-tusked elephant died by the shores of an ancient lake in Schoningen, Lower Saxony. It is believed the mammal died of old age as it was too risky for humans to hunt.

item.title: Paw patrol! Footage shows Boston Dynamics' robot dog Spot herding sheep on a farm in New Zealand
item.description: Spot gathered together the animals with the help of two sheepdogs in New Zealand. The robot can reach speeds of up to 3mph and costs less than an average car to lease, at £30,000.

item.title: Union accuses airlines of exaggerating impact of...
item.description: Balpa general secretary Brian Strutton said airlines were 'egging the pudding too much,' over the potential impact of the coronavirus crisis. British Airways, Ryanair and Virgin Atlantic have all announced job cuts.

item.title: Nurse disciplined after wearing only lingerie under see-through PPE gown in Russia
item.description: A nurse in her 20s, who has not been named, was pictured wearing only underwear beneath a PPE gown on a male COVID ward in Russia after saying she was 'too hot' in her uniform.

item.title: Administrators probe £520,000 loans made to the Duchess of York from troubled entertainment company
item.description: The Duchess of York was a former director of the company. She received a £290,000 personal loan from Gate, while Ginger & Moss, a tea company that she set up, received a loan of £232,000.

item.title: Architects design detailed floor plans of Buckingham Palace to offer look inside Queen's home
item.description: Serbian architect Jelena Popovic teamed up with British home improvement firm HomeAdvisor to produce their own detailed plans of Buckingham Palace, by dividing it up into three core sections.

item.title: All new Volvos now come a speed-limiting 'Care Key'
item.description: The key is predominantly aimed at parents who lend their pricey motors to their newly-licenced adult children. Owners can set the limit for when to key fob is in use to anything between 31 and 112mph.

item.title: Hearts 'respond in very different ways to same piece of music'
item.description: Two hearts respond differently to the same piece of music, either by speeding up or slowing down, according to a new study backed by the European Society of Cardiology.

item.title: Over 100 arrested, two shot at Texas' annual Go Topless Jeep weekend beach celebration
item.description: At this year's annual Go Topless Jeep Weekend celebration at Crystal Beach in Texas 189 people were arrested and two were shot as revelers partied in their trucks and in the sand.

item.title: Robert Buckland admits the government 'CHOSE' NHS over care homes
item.description: Robert Buckland gave the clearest statement yet that a decision was made to prioritise the health service when the outbreak was at its most ferocious.

item.title: Jean-Claude Van Damme says the secret to keeping fit at 59 is the correct posture
item.description: Jean-Claude Van Damme, 59, appeared on GMB from his LA home, where he said that to exercise well, you first have to correct your posture by rolling shoulders down and opening the rib cage.

item.title: GMB journalist confronts Justice Secretary Robert Buckland live on TV outside Parliament
item.description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland was confronted by Good Morning Britain journalist Jonathan Swain live on air amid the government's boycott of the ITV morning news programme.

item.title: Tracey Cox reveals why OUTDOOR sex is on the rise
item.description: After lockdown rules were eased in the UK to allow unlimited daily time outdoors, Tracey Cox reveals why couples who live together will be looking to spice things up with outdoor intimacy.

item.title: Woman who shopped online EVERY night, bans herself from making purchases
item.description: Zoe Paterson, 38, from Angus, Scotland, would order the same item in a variety of colours, and while she would send some of her purchases back, she needed a diary to keep track.

item.title: 'Thrilled' Colonel Tom reveals what he'll say to monarch
item.description: Colonel Tom Moore, a centenarian from Bedfordshire who has already been promoted from captain, is to be recognised further with a knighthood, it was revealed last night.

item.title: Flipping clever! Teenager throws coins in the air to spell out a cute message
item.description: Maxim Kokoshinskiy, 18, from Denver, Colorado, painstakingly arranged old nickels and dimes on a piece of black cardboard before flipping them to spell out 'You are cute' followed by a heart shape.

item.title: Fighter jet buzzes runway workers with an ultra-low pass at Algerian Air Force base
item.description: A MiG-29 Fulcrum fighter jet took ground crew by surprise after the pilot performed an ultra-low flypast over Mecheria Air Base, Algeria.

item.title: Factory worker turned millionaire who's grown used to splashing his money on expensive
item.description: James, 24, from Southampton, went from school drop out to successful business owner and told 5Star's Rich Kids Go Homeless he would prove how easy it is to get off the streets.

item.title: Heartstopping moment father pushes a small child on a balcony swing 80ft above the pavement
item.description: The man was filmed pushing the young girl on the eighth floor of a Puerto Rican apartment block. Footage shows the girl fly towards the edge of the balcony each time the swing is pushed.

item.title: Inflation: How a basket of goods has altered in wake of lockdown
item.description: Pints of Guinness, cinema popcorn, haircuts and airport parking were all stripped out of Britain's latest inflation basket as statisticians tried to calculate price changes in the middle of the lockdown

item.title: Brazil suffers record daily coronavirus deaths and cases with 1,179 new fatalities
item.description: The alarming surge brings Brazil's death toll from 16,792 to 17,971 - with experts warning that the worst is yet to come (pictured, virus patients in a hospital in Manaus).

item.title: Inflation plunges to four-year low as fuel costs nosedive
item.description: Official figures showed the CPI measure tumbled by more than expected to 0.8 per cent last month - the lowest level since August 2016 and down from 1.5 per cent in March.

item.title: English teacher reveals difference between British, American and Australian slang
item.description: Lucy Bella Earl, 25, from Hertfordshire, runs the 'English with Lucy' YouTube channel. She revealed the difference in slang words in British, American and Australian English.

item.title: King of the jungle finds his queen: Lions born into captivity find happiness together
item.description: King of the jungle Luke and lioness Phuku defied the odds to form a strong bond at Love Lions Alive sanctuary in Free State, South Africa, after meeting earlier this year.

item.title: Heroin smuggler is sentenced to hang via Zoom call in Singapore
item.description: Punithan Genasan, a 37-year-old Malaysian, was told by a judge via Zoom call that he will be hanged in Singapore after being found guilty of trying to smuggle 63lbs of heroin into the city-state.

item.title: Boyfriend shamed for proposing to his girlfriend by placing his grandma's ring on a SAUSAGE finger
item.description: A 'romantic' man has been shamed on social media after he proposed to his girlfriend by placing his great grandmother's ring on a sausage before serving it to her for breakfast.

item.title: Personal trainer shares how she transformed her bum in three years by changing diet and exercise
item.description: A 30-year-old personal trainer from Melbourne has revealed how she completely transformed her bum in three years by changing up her diet and exercise routine, and how you can too.

item.title: Botswana probes mysterious death of 12 elephants
item.description: Botswana is investigating after at least 12 elephants were found dead in the country's Okavango River Delta in recent days, amid fears the animals may have accidentally eaten something poisonous.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the Royals during lockdown
item.description: 'Pity Andrew's been furloughed - he could've helped us save money doing this D.I.Y. refurb too'

item.title: It's going to be hotter than Malibu! Spring sun comes out for hottest day of the year so far
item.description: Some headed to the beach (pictured Bournemouth) as others practised yoga or read in peaceful corners of parks and some braved opted for a run along the River Thames.

item.title: It's great outdoors! How life is slowly returning to normal around Europe
item.description: In France, revellers packed on to beaches for the first weekend after lockdown while Spain saw restaurants and cafes preparing to open with social distancing measures at the tables.

item.title: U.S. is set to experience a 'hotter than average summer' from June through August
item.description: Most of the continental 48 states will experience a warmer-than-average summer. The Northeast and mid-Atlantic states should expect above-average temperatures from June through August.
